text:
Foley Square, northward, from the Municipal Building, showing this civic center prior to improvement. Thru the center runs Centre Street (cartracks). On the left and right respectively are Lafayette and Park Streets. The solitary one story clinical (narcotic addictions) faces on Worth Street. Columbus Park is in the right background. This open area, the Collect Pond site, has not as yet been improved because of shifting sands. Engineering advances will enable this danger to be avoided. Incidentally this was the scene of the first work relief program in New York; the Pond being filled in by men that were thrown out of work by the embargo declared by President Jefferson in 1812. He, fearing naval complications with Great Britain closed the port.

Gift of E. M. Jenks

1916-7
title: Manhattan: Foley Square - Municipal building.

text:
(1) Baxter Street, west side, north from Leonard (extreme left, not shown), and across Franklin (center) Streets, showing buildings at the corners of the latter point about to be demolished. Two entire blocks will eventually fall here and upon their sites will rise a new Criminal Courts Building, replacing the old structure on Center Street. Note at the right, the western edge of Columbus Park.

February 5, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

(2) A latter view from Franklin Street, showing the buildings at the N.W. corner already down, with the balance about to fall. The 10 and 12 story loft buildings seen across same are No's. 124-28-32 White Street.

April 23, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.

(3) A northwestward view from the same vantage point as the preceding view. The lone building appearing on the north side of Franklin Street is Fire Patrol No. 1. To the left, appears the about to be replaced Criminal Courts Building.

April 23, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Baxter Street, north from and including Franklin Street. Part of Columbus Park is seen in the foreground.
March 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a more inclusive view. Shown on the far side of Columbus Park is the north side of Bayard Street, east to Mulberry Street.
March 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Baxter Street, north from and including Franklin Street. Part of Columbus Park is seen in the foreground.

(2)

P. L. Sperr.

(1 & 2)

Columbus Park: A set of 2 views showing the upper half of same as viewed northward from the New York State Office Building. Shown, forming the boundaries of same, are Baxter (left) Mulberry (right) and Bayard (center) Streets. It was this area that formed the famous Five Points.

March 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)

A more complete view of this public improvement, as seen from the southern edge, Worth Street (right foreground).

November 6, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Mulberry Street, at, adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of Park Street. A general view, looking east is seen of the lower east side section of Manhattan. In the foreground is shown a portion of Columbus Park. March 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr,

(2) A continuation of same, showing a view further north to, and including Bayard Street. Public School No. 23 is seen on the N.E. corner of Mulberry and Bayard Streets. March 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Baxter Street, west side, north from Franklin and across White Streets, showing in the foreground a block of buildings that will be demolished. Upon their site will rise the new Criminal Courts Building.
November 6, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A detail of same, showing Nos. 70, 68, 66 and 64 (right to left). The last two are at the N.W. and S.W. corners of Franklin Street, respectively. Photographers vantage point is at Bayard Street; the northern confine of Columbus Park (left).
November 6, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
Nos. 72 and 74 Baxter Street, as viewed westward on Bayard Street.
November 6, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Franklin Street, east from Centre to Baxter Streets, showing on both sides, clearances upon which will rise the new Criminal Courts Bldg. and prison. These will replace the old Court Bldg. and the Tombs on the opposite side of Centre Street. For an account of same, see the New York Times of Aug. 1, 1938, page 21.

P. L. Sperr

(2)
A northeastward view across the northly unit, to show buildings at the N.E. corner of Baxter (left) and Bayard (right) Streets. To the right of same appears P.S. No. 23 at the N.E. corner of Bayard and Mulberry Street and a portion of Columbus Park.

June 18, 1938.

P. L. Sperr
